function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Environmental and climatic conditions contributing to the upsurge of vector-borne diseases vbd such as wnf and malaria in southeast europe.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urbanization, urban sprawl, and high population densities are associated with vector-borne disease vbd emergence.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Habitat encroachment and destruction lead to displacement of wild animals, affecting exposure patterns to infectious pathogens.","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Approximately 60% of human pathogens are estimated to be of zoonotic origin","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Land-use can indirectly determine the spread of zoonotic diseases through exposure pathways in different urban, sub-urban, and rural settings","category":"Land Use","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different effects of methods on different types of buildings could lead to inconsistent control of disease transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Positive effect of methods in all types of buildings may lead to a false sense of security","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Varying effects of methods in different risk buildings may result in inadequate disease prevention in high-risk buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate use of infectious prevention methods in building design and construction","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of building type in the effectiveness of prevention methods","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unequal variances between buildings due to method type","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differential effectiveness of methods based on building type","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficiency of type 3 methods in low and medium-risk buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interaction effect of method and structure is not significant","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sphericity test not meeting significance level","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Incorrect interpretation of test results for effects within the subjects","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Different coping methods may have varying effects in different types of buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Observed covariance matrices are not equal between different construction groups","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Significance and non-significance of multivariate tests can influence the interpretation of the study results","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"The measures in design and construction have the highest score in all three types of buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The studied methods have the highest scores in high and very high-risk buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Examination of the effect of implementing prevention methods on different types of buildings may lead to the spread of contagious diseases if the methods are not effective or if the buildings are not properly managed.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Testing hypothesis about the effect of coping methods on different types of buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of the relationship between built environments and covid-19 transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of risk assessment and management in building services maintenance","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systemic study on covid-19 response in the built environment","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient knowledge and guidance on combating covid-19 in facilities management","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear relation between environmental contamination and clinical infection","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission route through stool viral shedding","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate decontamination measures for air outlets and equipment","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hvac system potentially contributing to airborne pathogen transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in air and on surfaces in healthcare environments","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in health and safety risks based on work environment outdoors vs. enclosed","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interdependent relation between health and the built environment in controlling covid-19 spread","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Hypothetical scenario of moving population to a flourishing state","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Risk of biased results due to two-step modeling approach","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misinterpreting categorical variables in the models","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Two-part model for analysis","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Comparison of prevalence estimates","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Presence of contagious psychiatric conditions","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete assessment of physical activity level","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cross-tabulation analysis reported moderate agreement with operational definitions of flourishing, potentially indicating subjective interpretation of the criteria.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conversion of costs to international dollars using an online conversion tool","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Non-prospective studies with non-randomized samples","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of decent housing, running water, proper sanitation, and waste management systems in slum areas, increasing the threat of pandemic spread.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rising temperatures, increase in wildfires, hurricanes, droughts, and floods due to climate change.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Drastic reduction in human activity due to covid-19 crisis leading to a temporary decline in emissions, with a subsequent projected rise in emissions as restrictions are lifted.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to safe drinking water and sanitation systems","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-exposure to covid-19 for women in health and social services sector","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
